context: where can I download an operating manual
response: I've never needed an operating manual, per se, since the stick itself is pretty self-explanatory. But maybe you are looking for information about how to program the stick, or profiles for particular games? If so, go to http://www.ch-hangar.com/forum/ to find a number of forums with plenty of help, including a "Dummies" guide under the downloads section.

context: i have a wii system does this game work with both wii and nintendo systems
response: Just on your wii system

context: Is the palm rest removeable?
response: It is removable because I used it without the palm rest.

context: Do these headphones offer sidetone? That is, can you hear your own voice through the mic?
response: You can always set that option through playback devices in Windows. Just right click on the mic device in playback and choose listen to.

context: is Wii motion required?
response: Yes. Each controller needs one-I believe.

context: what is the difference between  the gba and the gba sp ?
response: The GBA SP is designed more like the old Game Boy Color, but it folds in the middle, making it more compact.

context: Is this unit region-specific?
response: Nope, the PS Vita is region free! If you decide to buy import games, you just have to use a seperate memory card; one per region.

context: My son plays games on his MacBook Air.  Are they compatible with a MacBook?
response: I am sure it is compatible with MacBook or any laptop. But I wouldn't know for sure because mine broke in less than 3 months, before I could use it on other devices.

context: How many batteries is included? 1 or 2?
response: It comes with only one battery.

context: If we get a download code, where do we download it?  Don't want to use steam if possible?
response: NP. DL is straight to your HD

context: What does it mean by "DLC valid till 2015,march 31"? Does this game have DLC?
response: No Idea. I bought it just so I could have a physical copy. I've never opened it.

context: Do these headphones have that typical annoying flashing blue light!?
response: Check my picture http://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-media/product-gallery/B00H1FCUBY/ref=cm_cr_dp_cust_img_see_all_txt. It's a recessed light and not very visible because it points down. Also like the other answer said it is quiet dim. I guess if you were in a low light situation and pointed it at someone they would be bothered bothered by it.

context: Does this bundle have everything needed to play regular ps 3 games. Not just move games. Or do I need another console?
response: this bundle comes with everything you need to play your games . the move is just an extra bonus .

context: if u buy the headset do u need to get an adapter or something im not sure
response: If you have a first or second gen 360 and wanting to use hdmi cables (if your wanting to hear the gameplay through the headphones), than yes. If no hdmi than it just plugs in with your av cords...... scratch all that, no you don't need adapter cables unless you actually do.

context: what games are included?
response: These are included: Bridge, Canasta, Crazy Eights, Cribbage, Euchre, Gin, Go Fish, Hearts, Memory Match, Old Maid, Pinochle, Pitch, Poker, Rummy 500, Skat, Solitaire (40+ variations), Spades, Spite & Malice, Tuxedo, and War.

context: does it come with wireless controlars
response: Yes it does 1 wireless remote

context: Can you do 2 players on this console? And How?
response: Purchase an additional controller and nunchuck. It may be helpful to purchase 2 steering wheels for the Mario kart game as well. I would make sure the controller and nunchuck are manufactured by Wii.

context: Can photos taken with the 2DS be downloaded to a computer?
response: I just loaded them to Facebook from my 2DS, then downloaded them to my computer. Since it uses a Sim Card I would assume you could put it in the Sim card slot on your computer, I would also think you could take the Sim card to a photo kiosk and print them out. Honestly I haven't tried though.

context: I have a question will this fit a 3ds xl and a AC adapter in it?
response: Yes it can fit a whole 3DS XL, 2 extra games, in-ear headphones and an AC adapter. In my opinion its a great buy.

context: Can you turn the light off? Or, does it turn off while in stand-by mode?
response: You cannot manually turn the light off on the stand itself. The light will stay lit in stand by mode, so you have to either unplug the USB cable OR turn off USB charging on the PS4 itself. Hope that helps!Jeff :-)

context: I've heard the x and o button are backwards, is that true and then is it possible to change it and have x as enter and o as back?
response: Japanese imported Vitas do have O for confirm and X for back. You can't change that. But it's only for the main menu! If you're buying Western games, it isn't like that.I've gotten kind of used to it since the games still have O for back and X for confirm.

context: Flight Sim Seat Possibility? Is it possible to get a pair of the Playseats Gearshift Holder Mounts to put on both sides of the playseat and have a flight sim cockpit?
response: It looks like the user photos have been removed. There isnt really anything for me to sell, its just a $10 modification to the Gear Shift Holder which you can order thru amazon. Send me your email and I can send you some pics.

context: Is this is 100-240v. Is this works for Xbox 360 pro.
response: I'm not sure, this one works on my old xbox360 which is not the newer slim type.

context: Has anyone tried this on PC with success?
response: Worked just fine with PCSX2 on my desk top.

context: Why did this product come in a paper sleave instead of the protective plastic blue ray case?
response: My LEGO Hobbit came in a plastic blu-ray case.

context: I am a real novice.  What is a steam account?
response: Steam is a video game download service. Free to join but it allows you to purchase video games for download.

context: What kind of plug does this have? I'm looking for s USB controller.
response: It has USB. But the controller is not good, the sticks were not accurate and lagged. I have used it once.

context: I'm not experienced with refurbished products, will this have the same lifespan and quality as a new unit? I know ASTRO quality checks them the same.
response: You get the same 1 year warranty. Go for it, I did, and I certainly don't regret it.
